info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 9:51AM EDT until June 14 at 10:15AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT FOR WETZEL...MARSHALL AND SOUTHWESTERN MARION COUNTIES... At 951 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lumberport, or near Clarksburg, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Pine Grove, Jacksonburg, Smithfield, Porters Falls, Wileyville, Big Run, Reader, Folsom, Knob Fork, Curtisville, Grangeville, and Earnshaw. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
